# Module Infosys AdminRole

	- [Installation](#markdown-header-installation)
	- [Configuration](#markdown-header-configuration)
	- [Main Functionalities](#markdown-header-main-functionalities)

## Installation

	- Enable the module by running `php bin/magento module:enable Infosys_AdminRole`
	- Apply database updates by running `php bin/magento setup:upgrade` command
	- Generate static content for Admin html by running `php bin/magento setup:static-content:deploy -f --area adminhtml`
	- Flush the cache by running `php bin/magento cache:flush`

# Purpose #
This module provides customizations for the SSO integration to ForgeRock and Dealer Daily

1. Evaluates Users Role and Website Access based on SSO Response
   1. See `Infosys/AdminRole/Observer/AdminLoginObserver.php`

//TODO This README needs to be updated with all functionality of this module.

# Bypass Two-Factor Authentication #
New setting allows the user to skip two-factor authentication when signing in via SSO. This setting can be accessed at:

`Stores -> Configuration -> Services -> SAML SSO for admins (backend) -> Options -> Bypass Two-Factor Authentication`

This setting is disabled by default.


# Debugging #
See newrelic logs.  Validate user role mapping result.  Configuration in Stores -> Configuration -> Services -> SAML SSO for admind (backend)


Stage: https://one.newrelic.com/logger?account=3211212&duration=1800000&filters=%28domain%20%3D%20%27APM%27%20AND%20type%20%3D%20%27APPLICATION%27%29&state=a8cdae0d-364b-1883-293a-8c7e6d951e07

Prod: https://one.newrelic.com/logger?account=3211212&duration=1800000&filters=%28domain%20%3D%20%27APM%27%20AND%20type%20%3D%20%27APPLICATION%27%29&state=404eea63-8aff-7ef4-2cdb-770bd8f73ea3

Further debug logging can be enabled in Debug section.


# Guide For testing locally #
The full SSO integration will not work locally so here's the workaround to simulate an SSO response
1. Enable Simulation Mode
2. Enable Logging and Tail logs for more information
3. Set Simulator Response for appropriate user
4. Hit Backend Login Page and you will be logged in with that user



## Enable simulation mode ##
Simulation mode will only work in developer mode
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_enabled 1
```
It will also require you to modify one file `vendor/onelogin/php-saml/src/Saml2/Response.php`

Add `return true;` at the beginning of the `isValid()` function so that it always returns true

``` php
public function isValid($requestId = null)
    {
+       return true;
        $this->_error = null;
        try {
```
**Note**: Plugins and Preferences can't be used on this class because it is instantiated manually with `new` keyword. 


## Enable Logging and Tail logs for more information ##
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/enable_logging 1
tail -f var/log/dealer_login.log
```

## Queries for validation ##

### See all roles ###
```mysql
select * from authorization_role where role_type = 'G'; 
```
### See Users from tests ###
```mysql
select * from admin_user where username in ('testcorporateuser','testdealerorderuser','testdealerprogramuser','testmultiplerolecorpuser','testmultipleroleuser','testnoroleuser','testregionuser');
```
### Show users website access and role ###
```mysql
select 
username, website_ids, u.all_website, rr.role_name
from admin_user u
inner join authorization_role r on r.user_id = u.user_id
inner join authorization_role rr on r.parent_id = rr.role_id
where username in ('testcorporateuser','testdealerorderuser','testdealerprogramuser','testmultiplerolecorpuser','testmultipleroleuser','testnoroleuser','testregionuser');
```
### Delete all test users ###
```mysql
delete from admin_user where username in ('testcorporateuser','testdealerorderuser','testdealerprogramuser','testmultiplerolecorpuser','testmultipleroleuser','testnoroleuser','testregionuser');
```

## Set Simulator Responses ##

Below are quickset Base64 values you can use for testing

You can create your own Base64 by Setting Values in the xml and then use this tool to convert
https://developers.onelogin.com/saml/online-tools/code-decode/base64

See sample XML files in directory `Test/simulation-xml-files/`

### Test Region User. see sso-sample-region-user.xml ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

### Test Undefined Index roleid error (region user) ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

### Test Corporate User. see sso-sample-corporate-user.xml ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

### Test Dealer Order Processing User. see sso-sample-dealer-order-processing-user.xml ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

### Test Dealer Program Management User. see sso-sample-dealer-program-management-user.xml ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

### Test Corporte & Dealer User . see sso-sample-corporate-dealer-user.xml ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

### Test Multipe Roles User . see sso-sample-multiple-role-user.xml ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

### Test No Role User . see sso-sample-no-role-user.xml ###
``` shell
php bin/magento config:set pitbulk_saml2_admin/debug/simulator_response ""
```

# Integration and Unit Testing #

### Test evaluation of website Ids based on SSO input Dealer and Region codes ###
``` shell
n98-magerun dev:console
$data = $di->create(Infosys\AdminRole\Helper\Data::class);
$data->getDealerWebsite("34089");
$data->getRegionalWebsite("11");
$data->calculateWebsiteIds("11", "34089");
$data->calculateWebsiteIds(null, "34089");
$data->calculateWebsiteIds("11", null); 
```
 Example output
 ```
  $ n98-magerun dev:console
Magento 2.4.2-p2 Enterprise initialized ✔
At the prompt, type help for some help.To exit the shell, type ^D.
Psy Shell v0.11.0 (PHP 7.4.27 — cli) by Justin Hileman
New version is available (current: v0.11.0, latest: v0.11.8)
>>> $data = $di->create(Infosys\AdminRole\Helper\Data::class);
=> Infosys\AdminRole\Helper\Data {#6987}
>>> $data->getDealerWebsite("34089");
=> [
     "5",
   ]
>>> $data->getRegionalWebsite("11");
=> [
     "11",
     "12",
     "18",
   ]
>>> $data->calculateWebsiteIds("11", "34089");
=> [
     "11",
     "12",
     "18",
     "5",
   ]
>>> 
>>>

     "5",
   ]

   ]
 ```
